title: Why is getting an S so hard?
body: So, as a jungle main right when mastery 7 came out my goal was to reach mastery 7, so i worked and i worked, as Shaco, got to mastery 6 then i worked  and went 13/1/3 one game and it gave me an S- so now im wondering what do you have to do to get an S, anybody know?

replies.body: This has been answered about 500 times.

Yeah i went  3- -3- -12 with thresh and get an s rank.  One game i went 8- 0-- 34 and got an S +  the next time i went 4 --1 --12 i didnt even get an S-.  THey claim they base it off the game or other people in your elo playing that champion, but they base it off your previous ratios.
i had gone 12/1 to get my first S and i didnt cs very well then i went 15/2 with 160 cs was that not enough? Do they compare your score to your best with that character or your average score?
S and S+ especially are intended to be for games where you are somewhere between godlike and perfect.
I just played a game where i went 15/2/14 with 169 cs and i still only got an S-, is that not good for shacos in silver 5?

>Why is getting an S so hard?

Because it is defined as playing a game and ending with results far better than most people who played that champion.

That, by its inherent nature, is not going to be easy for most people.

Grades are based on other people who play the same champion in the same position.  Picture it like a bell curve, where B ranks are the most common.  S ranks are supposed to be difficult to get because they show you were playing like the best players of that champion in that role.

We don't have many actual details about what goes into the grades, so all I can really say is good luck and try to close your games quickly.
